wiki.summary: On “River,” Kanye West and Ty Dolla $ign plea for their sins to be absolved in a river of purity, addressing false ideologies in the rap scene. The two are joined by Young Thug, who was incarcerated on a sweeping Racketeering indictment during 2022, enabling Ye to employ a melodic delivery for Thug’s freedom, as well as Larry Hoover — founder of the Gangster Disciples street gang based in Chicago. The track was previewed at Jamaican restaurant in Miami on December 10, 2023, a day prior to the rave listening party for VULTURES. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: On “River,” Kanye West and Ty Dolla $ign plea for their sins to be absolved in a river of purity, addressing false ideologies in the rap scene. The two are joined by Young Thug, who was incarcerated on a sweeping Racketeering indictment during 2022, enabling Ye to employ a melodic delivery for Thug’s freedom, as well as Larry Hoover — founder of the Gangster Disciples street gang based in Chicago. The track was previewed at Jamaican restaurant in Miami on December 10, 2023, a day prior to the rave listening party for VULTURES. This track was supposed to drop on Vultures Vol. 1 according to the 8th of December 2023 tracklist, but the album didn’t drop on 12/12. It was also seen on the January 2024 tracklist. Finally VULTURES 1 dropped and this song is being considered for VULTURES 2. The 12/12/23 Miami Listening Party for Vultures was the first official public preview of this song from Kanye and Ty Dolla $ign’s upcoming collaborative album. It was previewed again by Kanye West and Ty Dolla $ign at a private listening party in LA on March 9th 2024 with an altered instrumental. The track would be released as the 10th track on VULTURES 2 with new production, and would have a feature from Charlie Wilson for the outro of the track Read more on Last.fm.
